messages.subject: Re: Magnetic Walls
messages.msgSnippet: Crystal; That sounds lots of fun: rock climbing and drawing center! Joy
messages.messageBody:
Crystal;

That sounds lots of fun: rock climbing and drawing center!

Joy

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "Sorschasmom" <willowsfortress@...> wrote:
>
> <<Will the powder from the chalk be all over the carpet?>>
>
> We have an indoor cement wall (in Kiba's craft area) that we painted and
> turned into an indoor rock climbing wall. She chose to make the wall into a
> drawing center also. So, we've got a painted, chalk writing, rock climbing
> wall. <g> In our situation (cement wall), the chalk does puddle at the
> bottom of wall. However, we use (okay, Dave uses) the vacuum attachment to
> just suck it up.
> ~Crystal in New Mexico~
>

messages.subject: Magnetic Walls
messages.msgSnippet: We have an indoor cement wall (in Kiba s craft area) that we painted and turned into an indoor rock
messages.messageBody:
<<Will the powder from the chalk be all over the carpet?>>

We have an indoor cement wall (in Kiba's craft area) that we painted and
turned into an indoor rock climbing wall. She chose to make the wall into a
drawing center also. So, we've got a painted, chalk writing, rock climbing
wall. <g> In our situation (cement wall), the chalk does puddle at the
bottom of wall. However, we use (okay, Dave uses) the vacuum attachment to
just suck it up.
~Crystal in New Mexico~
